1.text: A good name is above good oil, and the day of death above the day of birth.

2.text: Good to go to the house of mourning rather than to go to the house of drinking, in that it is the end of every man; and he living shall give to his heart.

3.text: Good is grief above laughter: for in the illness of the face the heart shall be good.

4.text: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; and the heart of the foolish in the house of gladness.

5.text: Good to hear the reproof of the wise one, above a man hearing the song of the foolish:

6.text: For as the voice of thorns under the pot, so the laughter of the foolish one. Also this is vanity.

7.text: For oppression will make foolish the wise one; and a gift will destroy the heart.

8.text: Good the last of a word above its beginning: good slowness of spirit above pride of spirit.

9.text: Thou shalt not be hastened in thy spirit to be angry, for anger shall rest in the bosom of fools.

10.text: Thou shalt not say, Why was it the former days were good above these? for thou didst not ask from wisdom concerning this.

11.text: Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and a remainder to those seeing the sun.

12.text: For in the shadow, wisdom; in the shadow, silver: and the excellence of knowledge is wisdom shall preserve alive those possessing it.

13.text: See the work of God: for who shall be able to make straight what he made it crooked?

14.text: In the day of good, be in good; and in the day of evil, see thou: also God made this over against this, to the end that man shall not find anything after him.

15.text: I saw all in the days of my vanity: there is a just one perishing in his justice, and there is an unjust one, being prolonged in his evil.

16.text: Thou shalt not be greatly just; and thou shalt not be exceedingly wise: wherefore wilt thou be made desolate?

17.text: Thou shalt not be greatly wicked, and thou shalt not be foolish: wherefore wilt thou die not in thy time?

18.text: Good that thou shalt hold fast upon this; also from this thou shalt not lead away thy hand: for he fearing God shall come forth with all of them.

19.text: Wisdom shall strengthen to the wise one more than ten having power which were in the city.

20.text: For not a just man in the earth, who shall do good and not sin.

21.text: Also to all the words that shall be spoken thou shalt not give thy heart, that thou shalt not hear thy servant cursing thee.

22.text: For also many times thy heart knew that thou didst also curse others.

23.text: All this I proved by wisdom: I said I will be wise, and it was removed far off from me.

24.text: What was far off, and the depth, deep, who shall find it?

25.text: I went round about, I and my heart, to know, and to examine, and to search out wisdom and understanding, and to know the injustice of folly, and the folly of wickedness:

26.text: And I find bitter above death the woman that her heart it is snares and nets, her hands are bonds: the good one before God shall escape from her, and he sinning shall be taken by her.

27.text: See, this I found, said the preacher: one to one to find understanding.

28.text: Which yet my soul sought, and found not; one man from a thousand I found; and a woman in all these I found not.

29.text: Only see, this I found, that God made man upright; and they sought out many purposes.
